messages.message:
Easier way to do this would be to just `poetry env use $(pyenv root)/versions/3.9.17/bin/python`

`3.9.17` comes preinstalled in the instabase-dev snapshot, which is what the ibdev-backend / ibdev / frontend templates are based on -- you do not need to do anything through `apt` (nor should you as this will very likely conflict with `pyenv`)

we default to setting the global version to `3.7.3` because something in our precommit scripts is incompatible with newer versions of python -- if someone wants to fix this up so we can default to `3.9.17` it would help a bunch!
Interesting, yeah we should fix precommit
How can I reproduce the issue with the pre commit, I can take a look at it, seems like a silly thing to be stuck on 3.7 for

I've seen it pop up from either
• `pyenv global 3.9.17`, then commit some changes
• `pyenv global 3.9.17` + `make init` at the root of the repo
For me, this issue seemed to come up when generating protos via make build-protos
@Sayan I think your issue was because you were using 3.7 instead of 3.9 right? The error wasn’t because of something wrong with 3.9 afaict
Oh yeah sorry I misunderstood, I'm not sure what the issue with 3.9 is
